item.title: Debra add a quote by John Wayne
item.description: "Tomorrow is the most important thing in life. Comes into us at midnight very clean. It's perfect when it arrives and it puts itself in our hands. It hopes we've learned something from yesterday." -- John Wayne

item.title: Debra add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Debra add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Debra add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Debra add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Debra add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Debra add a quote by Madeleine L'Engle
item.description: "You have to write the book that wants to be written. And if the book will be too difficult for grown-ups, then you write it for children." -- Madeleine L'Engle

item.title: Debra add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Debra add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"And on the subject of burning books: I want to congratulate librarians, not famous for their physical strength or their powerful political connections or their great wealth, who, all over this country, have staunchly resisted anti-democratic bullies who have tried to remove certain books from their shelves, and have refused to reveal to thought police the names of persons who have checked out those titles.
So the America I loved still exists, if not in the White House or the Supreme Court or the Senate or the House of Representatives or the media. The America I love still exists at the front desks of our public libraries." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Debra add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Make it a rule never to give a child a book you would not read yourself." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Debra add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Truth is stranger than fiction, but it is because Fiction is obliged to stick to possibilities; Truth isn't." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Debra add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "You can never get a cup of tea large enough or a book long enough to suit me." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "I have always imagined that Paradise will be a kind of library." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Debra add a quote by Henry Ward Beecherr
item.description: "Where is human nature so weak as in the bookstore?" -- Henry Ward Beecherr

item.title: Debra add a quote by Malcolm X
item.description: "My alma mater was books, a good library.... I could spend the rest of my life reading, just satisfying my curiosity." -- Malcolm X

item.title: Debra add a quote by Henry David Thoreau
item.description: "Books are the treasured wealth of the world and the fit inheritance of generations and nations." -- Henry David Thoreau

item.title: Debra add a quote by Saul Bellow
item.description: "People can lose their lives in libraries. They ought to be warned." -- Saul Bellow

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jessamyn West
item.description: "Fiction reveals truth that reality obscures." -- Jessamyn West

item.title: Debra add a quote by Judy Blume
item.description: "[I]t's not just the books under fire now that worry me. It is the books that will never be written. The books that will never be read. And all due to the fear of censorship. As always, young readers will be the real losers." -- Judy Blume

item.title: Debra add a quote by Joan Bauer
item.description: "My grandma always said that God made libraries so that people didn't have any excuse to be stupid." -- Joan Bauer

item.title: Debra add a quote by John Berry
item.description: "If your library is not "unsafe," it probably isn't doing its job." -- John Berry

item.title: Debra add a quote by James Russell Lowell
item.description: "Books are the bees which carry the quickening pollen from one to another mind." -- James Russell Lowell

item.title: Debra add a quote by Philip Pullman
item.description: "After nourishment, shelter and companionship, stories are the thing we need most in the world." -- Philip Pullman

item.title: Debra add a quote by Clifton Fadiman
item.description: "When you reread a classic you do not see more in the book than you did before; you see more in you than there was before." -- Clifton Fadiman

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jane Evershed
item.description: "To read is to empower, To empower is to write, To write is to influence, To influence is to change, To change is to live"." -- Jane Evershed

item.title: Debra add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "I attempted briefly to consecrate myself in the public library, believing every crack in my soul could be chinked with a book." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Debra add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "I declare after all there is no enjoyment like reading! How much sooner one tires of any thing than of a book! -- When I have a house of my own, I shall be miserable if I have not an excellent library." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Debra add a quote by Martha Cooley
item.description: "In a few minutes I heard the books' voices: a low, steady, unsupressible hum. I'd heard it many times before. I've always had a finely tuned ear for a library's accumulations of echo and desire. Libraries are anything but hushed." -- Martha Cooley

item.title: Debra add a quote by Sheila Bourbeau
item.description: "A library is books and somewhere to put them and some people who want them there." -- Sheila Bourbeau
